intro: Daphniphyllum celebense, commonly known as the Celebes holly, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in montane forests. Its foliage is evergreen, and it produces berries that are edible for certain bird species. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable plant in botanical collections.
